game.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: an activity or sport in which people compete with each other according to agreed rules
game.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: We used to love playing games like chess or backgammon.
game.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: an occasion when a game is played
game.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Did you see the game on TV last night?
Would you like to have a game of tennis?
England’s World Cup game against Holland
game.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: one of the parts into which a single match is divided, for example in tennis or bridge1(4)
game.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Graf leads, two games to one.
game.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a children’s activity in which they play with toys, pretend to be someone else etc
game.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The boys were playing a game in the backyard.
game.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: wild animals, birds, and fish that are hunted for food, especially as a sport
game.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: an area of work or business
game.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: I’ve been in this game for over ten years.
game.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: They explained how to play the game.
Did you see the game last night?
They were having a game of pool.
A.C. Milan won the game with a last-minute goal.
Arsenal lost the game because of a mistake by their goalkeeper.
The game was tied 10-10 at halftime.
We played badly and were lucky to draw the game.
He was up all night playing computer games.
Bridge is a card game for four people.
board games such as Monopoly and Scrabble
I wasn't very good at team games when I was at school.
He was watching a baseball game on TV.
Next Saturday Liverpool have a home game against Manchester United.
We didn't win any away games last season.
There's a big league game against Chelsea on Saturday.
He hopes to play in the cup game on Wednesday.
This is the first of their five playoff games.
There is a hall for indoor games and social functions.
Outdoor games are affected by the weather.
It's against the rules of the game to pick up the ball.
game.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: willing to try something dangerous, new, or difficult
game.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Okay. I’m game if you are.
He’s always game for a laugh.
game.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: an activity in which people compete with each other according to agreed rules
game.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The market is a game which creates wealth through the process of production exchange.
game.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: the profession of advertising, public relations etc
game.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: The company is certainly not new to the publishing game.
game.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: to beat someone or fight back against them by using the same methods that they use
game.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: The computer manufacturer, Compaq, built its reputation by beating IBM at their own game.
